H0.text: Vegetative budding is the reproductive event that requires meiosis to occur.

H1.text: Binary fission is a reproductive event that requires meiosis.

H2.text: Cloning is a reproductive event that requires meiosis.

H3.text: Fertilization is the reproductive event that requires meiosis to occur.

A4.text: Meiosis results in a random segregation of the genes that each parent contributes. Each parent organism is usually identical save for a fraction of their genes; each gamete is therefore genetically unique.

A5.text: The evolution of fertilisation is related to the origin of meiosis, as both are part of sexual reproduction, originated in eukaryotes.
